title: X-Wing
description: Master the X-Wing pattern - a powerful advanced elimination technique

steps.title: Advanced Patterns
steps.content:
Welcome to Premium content! Learn **X-Wing** - one of the most powerful advanced patterns.

**What You'll Learn:**
- X-Wing pattern recognition (2x2 rectangle)
- Row-based and column-based X-Wings
- How to apply elimination

**Why It's Important:**
X-Wing solves puzzles that simpler techniques cannot. This pattern uses candidate constraints across multiple rows/columns simultaneously.

**Time Estimate:** 30 minutes

steps.title: The X-Wing Pattern
steps.content:
**X-Wing Definition:**
When a digit appears as a candidate in exactly 2 positions in each of 2 rows (or columns), and those positions align, forming a rectangle.

**Example:**
Digit 5 in Row 2: can be in columns 3 or 7
Digit 5 in Row 6: can be in columns 3 or 7

**This forms an X-Wing:**
```
    Col3  Col7
R2   5     5
R6   5     5
```

**Elimination:**
One corner gets the 5 in Row 2, opposite corner gets 5 in Row 6.
Therefore: eliminate 5 from ALL other cells in columns 3 and 7!

**The Logic:**
If R2 gets 5 in C3 ‚Üí R6 must get 5 in C7
If R2 gets 5 in C7 ‚Üí R6 must get 5 in C3
Either way, columns 3 and 7 have 5 locked in those rows.

**Requirements:**
- Exactly 2 rows (or 2 columns)
- Digit appears in exactly 2 positions per row/column
- Positions align to form rectangle
key_points: Digit in exactly 2 positions per row/column

steps.title: Practice X-Wing
steps.content:
Find and apply X-Wing patterns.

**Goal:** Complete at least 2 of 3 puzzles

puzzles.title: Row-Based X-Wing
hints: Track where digit 5 can go in each row
Find two rows where 5 appears in exactly same two columns

puzzles.title: Column-Based X-Wing
hints: Track where digit 7 can go in each column
Find two columns where 7 appears in exactly same two rows

questions.question: What defines an X-Wing?
options: A digit appearing in exactly 2 positions in each of 2 rows/columns, aligned in a rectangle
Two naked pairs in different rows
questions.explanation: X-Wing is when a digit appears in exactly 2 positions in each of 2 rows (or columns), and those positions align vertically (or horizontally) forming a rectangle.

questions.question: If you find an X-Wing with digit 8 in rows 3 and 7, at columns 2 and 6, what do you eliminate?
options: 8 from columns 2 and 6 (except the X-Wing cells)
questions.explanation: In a row-based X-Wing, eliminate the digit from the crossing columns (except the 4 X-Wing cells themselves).

questions.question: Why is it called X-Wing?
options: It looks like the X-Wing starfighter from Star Wars
The pattern forms an X shape
questions.explanation: It's called X-Wing because the pattern resembles the X-Wing starfighter from Star Wars, with elimination paths crossing like the ship's wings!
